p: For SAMOVA results of ITS, populations were divided into four groups (GITS1, Western Tarim Basin: WQ, SF, and KP; GITS2, Central Tarim Basin: BC1, BC2, KC, and LT; GITS3, Hami Basin + Hexi Corridor: HM1, HM2, HM3, AKS, SB, LY, CM, YM, JYG, and GT; and GITS4, Alxa Desert + Wulate Prairie: DX, AZQ, ZW, and WHQ) as F CT reached the maximum value ( F CT = 0.89225). The fixation index F ST by AMOVA and pairwise difference (Tables 4, 5) of ITS indicates that the greatest percentage (ITS: F ST = 89.22%) can be explained by among‐group variation. The SAMOVA analyses using cpDNA indicated that a grouping structure was not present, because the K values got higher as F CT got higher.
